title: I went to my divorce prove up hearing last week, and the judge entered a judgment default
question: After prove up. What does this mean?
question_tags: Divorce,Dividing debts in a divorce,Divorce by default judgment,Divorce and bankruptcy,Bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Divorce and family,Lawsuits and disputes,Family law,Default judgment
answers: It means that a Judgment was entered in your case and, because it was entered while the other party was in default (and not required/allowed to participate in judgment proceedings), it is called a Default Judgment.

The is a precise process in court when the other party decides not to respond to the summons and petition. You filed your petition. The other party did not respond. You filed a Request to Enter Default. The court granted it. Now, you have a judgment. The next part is the "prove-up" which means you must list what assets and debts are to be yours and his. This does not mean you have a blank check to take all the assets and leave him with all the debt. The court will still closely scrutinize the prove-up portion to make sure its fair to both sides. Consider consulting with an attorney. This is the most important part of the case, especially if there are retirement accounts/homes, etc.

Means that the Court granted your judgment. Also means opposing party did not respond to divorce. As long as all your paperwork has been completed, you should get your divorce papers in the mail soon.
